Also we haven't recompiled our native libraries to Universal Binaries yet, so VE on OS X x86 won't work anyways... I'm looking into this now.

FYI - the change to drop the arch from the OS X SWT plug-in was detailed in bug 138047

Checked in the fix to work with the changed SWT plug-in name on OS X.
I also checked in Universal Binaries of our jnilibs, so now we should run on x86.

"3) Select Standard Widget Toolkit (SWT) in Package Explorer and select Configure ... from the context menu"

- in the package explorer I have org.eclipse.swt, but I don't have Configure in the context menu for it.

I have Eclipse+GEF+EMF+VE installed.

Did you import org.eclipse.swt manually, or did you add the "SWT Library" using the Add Library... in the Library tab of the Java Build Path.

Note: A simpler way to go about this is to create a new Java Project, then create a new Visual Class based off of Shell.  The SWT Library will be added to your project automatically.
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991
